Author: Sherdogz#6731
Content: Hi I have kmd in my android guarda wallet but I keep getting an 16: tx-overwinter-active error..when trying to sen funds out of my wallet. Can I do something about it

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: @Sherdogz  have you contacted the Guarda team ? They should be up to date to the latest sapling implementation  but still Guarda is a third party wallet ...so you will need to contact them.

Author: Sherdogz#6731
Content: Yes I've contacted them they're working on the issue. I thought there was only a problem with claiming rewards but now I realize my funds are stuck. I thought maybe I'd get some information here.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Export private key and import it into agama

Author: Sherdogz#6731
Content: Is this possible?

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: Yes, Its possible, Export private key or seed and you can use to login agama Lite mode directly for accessing funds @Sherdogz

Author: Sherdogz#6731
Content: @Nabob thanks!, so export    key meaning importing seed in agama that's it? Or does exporting the seed require another step?

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: @Sherdogz  Yes, If you are in native mode you can import private key or you can login seed or private key  when using agama lite mode.

Author: Sherdogz#6731
Content: @Nabob thanks it worked fine 👌

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: @jasonabis  use this guide https://docs.komodoplatform.com/komodo/install-Komodo-manually.html

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: when you do git checkout dev you should up to date with the latest dev branch

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: will this guide make me do anything that will delete my wallet.dat?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: no this files won't be touched. you can continue in the same way as Alright suggested

Author: Hermes#6934
Content:
git clone https://github.com/jl777/komodo
git checkout dev
./zcutil/build.sh -j$(nproc)
cd src
./komodod -ac_name=MGNX -ac_supply=12465003 -ac_staked=90 -ac_reward=2000000000 -ac_halving=525960 -ac_cc=2 -ac_end=2629800 -addnode=142.93.27.180 &

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: if you have made it already this far in to the instructions you are doing a resync from scratch basically and you are also making sure that you are in the latest branch...it should work after finishing the instructions. You will start syncing blocks in the correct chain

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: ok,  so i need to refer to the guide? or just continue with what Alright suggested?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: continue with the instructions given by Alright no issues , the guide was just for you to see  the git checkout dev command but he has already given you that instruction

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: ok. so just skip the git clone https://github.com/jl777/komodo command?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: you already have the repository so you can continue.

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: ok. thank you sir!

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: just tried and got Fatal: Not a git repository (or any of the parent directories): .git

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Just one question , why you are using CLI if you don't have experience with Linux or CLi commands? Agama has MGNX in the wallet in native mode tab

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: because i was helping @MagnaDev with some tests... just following her directions. she's not around anymore to help.

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: and I don't know how to get my coins to the agama windows wallet.

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: and don't want to screw anything up or lose my coins...

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: hmmm ok ok understood here is where the error could be

Author: Hermes#6934
Content:
cd ~
git clone https://github.com/jl777/komodo
cd komodo
git checkout dev
./zcutil/fetch-params.sh

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: cd ~   you missed the  ~

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: try doing it again with the ~

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: see, that's how little i know.

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content:
root@MGNX:~/komodo# ./zcutil/fetch-params.sh
Zcash - fetch-params.sh

This script will fetch the Zcash zkSNARK parameters and verify their
integrity with sha256sum.

If they already exist locally, it will exit now and do nothing else.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: you already made git checkout dev ?

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: yeah, let me copy and paste it one sec.

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content:
root@MGNX:~# git clone https://github.com/jl777/komodo
fatal: destination path 'komodo' already exists and is not an empty directory.
root@MGNX:~# git checkout dev
fatal: Not a git repository (or any of the parent directories): .git
root@MGNX:~# ^C
root@MGNX:~# cd ~
root@MGNX:~# git clone https://github.com/jl777/komodo
fatal: destination path 'komodo' already exists and is not an empty directory.
root@MGNX:~# cd komodo
root@MGNX:~/komodo# git checkout dev
Branch dev set up to track remote branch dev from origin.
Switched to a new branch 'dev'
root@MGNX:~/komodo# ./zcutil/fetch-params.sh
Zcash - fetch-params.sh

This script will fetch the Zcash zkSNARK parameters and verify their
integrity with sha256sum.

If they already exist locally, it will exit now and do nothing else.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: ok now use

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: ./zcutil/build.sh -j$(nproc)

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: it can take some time ...

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: let me ask you, if my ultimate goal is to get these mgnx coins to agama wallet and stake them there, do i even have to do this? i think i tried and it wouldn't let me because i was on wrong chain.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: after it's done go back and do this commands ...

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Well to be honest you shouldn't because your wallet.dat is located in the same folder it doesn't matter if you are using  CLI or GUI ...so unless you are trying to learn command line you will just need to launch the coin in the latest version 0.3.2a  of the wallet ...here is it MGNX running with no issues so far

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Not quite sure why they suggested to use the CLI , I haven't heard about issues while using the GUI version of the wallet .

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: it was before the GUI wallet supported mgnx i guess.

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: so run in native?

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: actually, this is where i am.

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: oh, it won't let me paste screenshot

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: You can use imgur.com

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: But I would recommend using the GUi in any case here is the link for the latest version of the wallet https://komodoplatform.com/komodo-wallets/

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: https://imgur.com/a/GC4mgnX

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: the wallet that you are using is no longer up to date

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: oy

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: you need to download the new version ...you are stuck in block 114262

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: ok

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: ill do that and let it catch up. would you mind if i reach out to you tomorrow for help getting my coins safely from linux wallet to agama wallet?

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: i did this command and stopped there.  ./zcutil/build.sh -j$(nproc)

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: no problem ...you didn't went to a fork for what I can tell so actually after updating the wallet  is possible that your chain starts working normally

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: well, i never had my coins in the gui wallet

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: there is no risk of funds being lost...you haven't done anything for what I can tell that could have erased your wallet.dat file ...the same computer where you were using the command line is the same computer where you have agama currently installed right?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: if that's the case when you update to the new version of the Agama wallet and fully sync the chain you will be able to see your coins in Agama

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: ahh no, sorry i didn't mention that. linux wallet was on vps.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: so your funds are in a Linux VPS?

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: yes

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: the address that has the funds was created in a Linux VPS ok...

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: you can still do the same procedure in the VPS you can install Agama in the Linux server ...is it Ubuntu?

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: i'd rather just get it into my windows wallet. as you can see, i'm all thumbs when it comes to linux.

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: can i just use my wif key to get the funds into agama?

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: If you have the Wif key that has all your funds...that's very easy task you will just need to import the key as showed here  https://support.komodoplatform.com/solution/articles/29000024488-import-private-key-in-agama-native-mode/en

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: If you don't know if that Wif key that you have contains the complete funds of your wallet. I will suggest to use the linux version of Agama in the previous link that I sent before and run the native wallet and export the pertaining Wif key or send it to a new address that you control.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: In that way you can use the Agama wallet to manage your funds instead of the CLI in your VPS ...and save some time if you are not used to the CLI

Author: jasonabis#8549
Content: okay, I will follow the instructions in the link above to move the funds with my wif key. if they are all there, amazing. if not, i will do my best to follow the linux procedure you've outlined. thanks for being so patient and helping me.

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: no worries here to help...Agama makes things easier you can download it in your VPS and verify your funds ,then you can complete the task of exporting the pertaining WIF key holding  all your funds if needed and import them to your windows Pc wallet.

Content:
Few benefits of Komodo Platform:
- You get independent chain and customize it the way you like it
- tx fee is very low, only 0.0001
- CryptoConditions, dApps and limitless possibility
- Very easy and cheaper to get dPoW security
- Scalable
